website_summaries.verdict: Simple to use and offers a fun twist on an age-old staple.
pros: Easy to use and to remove from the mold
Makes 4 large ice balls per mold
cons: Ice balls are smaller than pictures make them appear

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like the picture
customer_reviews.text: Update. It appears I have been doing it wrong. I'm going to follow the instructions and try again and will correct my review accodingly so I''m giving this 3 stars with update expected. Very small cubes and they don't come out round. You have to trim the ice off the round cube. Nothing like the picture. If you like to spend 10 minutes working on the cubes with your hands you might be able to get a cube like the picture. I highly doubt it. Additional the ice is sharp to handle while trying to trim. I would not buy this item. I tried multiple times as well.
customer_reviews.author: MWN NR CCT

customer_reviews.title: The future of ice...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, if you end up with a weird looking frisbee, go back & read the instructions. Once we figured that out, they're awesome :) Ice balls melt far slower than cubes or other traditional ice used in drinks, meaning your drink stays colder longer without getting watered down anywhere near as fast. You also go through a lot less ice since they tend to last through more than 1 drink.
customer_reviews.author: MikeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: makes evening drinks a bit nicer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice ice globes for my periodic adult beverages. These are a nice size, 1-2 in a lowball with some whiskey or tequila is perfect. Filling them is a bit odd. It says to fill 3/4 up the bottom, then attach the top to push out overflow. That doesn't work for me. I put it all together, and fill each pocket up, and just leave the overflow; it will break off with opening. Each time the 4 globes have come out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: A2theJackson

customer_reviews.title: The final result is still a spherical ice cube/ball and is still a nice addition to cocktails
customer_reviews.text: The point of contact between the top and bottom is not a smooth seal and creates a seam in the middle of the sphere. I've tried several approaches to closing this gap including placing objects of differing weights on top without success. The final result is still a spherical ice cube/ball and is still a nice addition to cocktails. I'm still happy with my purchase and would recommend it to a friend with the above note.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all over
customer_reviews.text: Every one of these that I have tried (going on about 4 or 5 of them) has leaked like a sieve.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: Filling process is a waste of water, and makes a mess. I tried filling them, and water gushes out all over the place. Then, tried placing them in the freezer. Water was leaking out of the edges all over the place as I tipped out of level. I was initially so excited about this product, but less than 30 seconds after trying to use it, I threw it straight in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Garz Boy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: So great! Having round balls of ice, our scotch is now chilled , but not watered down. Wonderful to pull these out and sit down with my hubs with a nice glass of single malt or your own preferred beverage after a good day. Well made, freezes quickly. Love that it's food grade silicone, cleans easily and a snap to fill. . Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: deborah kumpula

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ice balls for your cocktail.
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I needed ice balls... yes, ice balls. This mold is one of a kind. The instructions are simple: Pour the water (I use bottled spring water) into the mold until 3/4 full, put on the lid, and push a little so the water comes out. Put into the freezer overnight and voila! Beautiful, clear and perfectly round ice balls for your old fashioned or manhattan glass. Definitely adds a touch of class, and doesn't dilute your drink. Don't know how I lived without this. Compact and fits nicely in my little freezer. I will also experiment and freeze juices with bits of fruit in them. Will be quite fancy. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: These aren’t much bigger than normal ice cubes.
customer_reviews.text: Wayyyyyyy too small. What’s the point? Might as well just have regular ice cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Yong H. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Added a nasty flavor
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice at 1st but after about 6 months there was a rubbery silicone (as I would imagine) flavor. I always used filtered water but this nasty taste came through so I threw them (I had 2) away.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: If your an ice lover like me I’d definitely recommend this item . There’s nothing worse than A hot drink that’s not supposed to be hot lol . With this product you literally only need one ball of ice in your cup of glass it lasts beyond the drink and it cools instantly. The directions are located on the box and are very simple to follow . There was no strong chemical smell and the rubber is very easy to clean. This was purchased for me as A gift and I love it
customer_reviews.author: LaLa

customer_reviews.title: Nice for small round Ice cubes
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It was inexpensive and is relatively easy to use. It can be a little messy with Ice chips when you remove the cubes but this can be remedied by doing it over the sink. The ice cubes melt a lot slower than those from my ice maker and that's perfect but I wish I had purchased one that makes larger cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Neil

customer_reviews.title: A Great Alternative for Small Freezers and for Replacing Bagged Ice
customer_reviews.text: I love the compact design of this mold. It takes up very little room in my small freezer. The ice balls come out easily. I bought this for my Chill cup to replace the bagged ice (which takes up way too much room). The first time, I put two balls in and was disappointed when they melted after a couple of hours. That didn't happen when I added all four the next time. The balls stayed frozen for up to six hours before I noticed a thaw. I'm tempted to order another mold to have as a backup. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Woehr

customer_reviews.title: I am a dumb american and don't readily understand metric
customer_reviews.text: That said, these are way smaller than I expected. They're closer to the size of a golf ball than they are to like a handball - which is what I had expected. Sure that's my fault, but the pictures don't lend themselves to that understanding well. These are a pain to fill, too flexible to keep from spilling all over the floor and freezer. I replaced them with the tevelo's I quite liked.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Works fair
customer_reviews.text: Does not include a funnel to top them off. The instructions say to fill the tray 3/4 of the way and assemble the 2 pieces. This forces the excess water out of the form. And that is a cool idea. BUT, there is no way to drain off the excess. If you lean the tray over to do this, the ball molds start emptying out. And the bottom tray being made of silicone too, rather than something more rigid, makes it really easy to get the frozen balls out, but when trying to put them into the freezer they wobble an collapse causing water to get forced out of the ball mold.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Howell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: “I really like this product! I strongly recommend watching the video to use it. After reading the instructions, something didn't seem right. After watching I realized my mistake. They came out great right from my 1st attempt and are a hit with our family,”
customer_reviews.author: stoods

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mold but the spheres don't come out perfect like in the photo. You will have to do a bit of chipping away of excess ice that forms between the mold pieces and maybe run the sphere under some cool running water to refine the shape but overall it's a decent product and does what it's supposed to do. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Lovelace

customer_reviews.title: They STINK and they're not evenly round
customer_reviews.text: First they're stinky and make stinky, regular sized ice balls. Fresh water and a clean refrige. They stink. Plus there's no way to remove them in a spherical shape. The edges are rough, and they're either overfilled after the water expands or they're underfilled and not round. I guess if you don't mind craggy, uneven ice balls, they're okay.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: The family loves this!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it makes ice balls. And the kids actually fight over them. Seriously, right? Who fights over ice? It makes round frozen water well. And it does really seem to not melt as quickly. I'm glad it's BPA free considering how much this get used. My only regret is that it only makes 4. I'm going to have to purchase additional ones. Ironically this frustrates me because I have a perfectly functioning ice maker in my freezer. Reluctantly, I have to admit it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: NH Mom

customer_reviews.title: Really cool product. Easy to pop the ice out of ...
customer_reviews.text: Really cool product. Easy to pop the ice out of the container because of its flexible material. The top and bottom fits one inside the other however you have to stop filling this without overflowing otherwise your ice ball has a little stick on top... which is truly no big deal. Item came fast which is surprising because I’m in Hawaii. Usually takes about a week but this came in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small.
customer_reviews.text: The ice balls are too small to use only one in a glass of whiskey which sort of defeats the purpose. It’s difficult to fill the mold without filling the top outside surface of the mold as well. Would be good if there was a hole for the outside to drain. It’s difficult to dump that excess water without also losing water from inside the mold.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaReader

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These are not made well. If you fill them up (which is almost impossible to do without a funnel) the top half floats up as you fill it which ruins the entire point of round ice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Balls too small!
customer_reviews.text: I was immediately surprised by how small these molds are. I thought I was getting the big cocktail sized balls, but these ones need at least 2 per glass to actually be enough to chill a cocktail. It’s also really hard to fill the mold without the water seeping into the space between the balls, and then when you unmold, each ball has planes of glass coming out the sides of it, kind of resembling Saturn. Not what I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stein

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mold about three months ago. The mold works remarkably well. The ice balls usually come out as you'd like (if you don't fill the tray properly, you CAN get some funky-looking results). The mold is pretty easy to fill, freeze, and empty. And the ice balls are neat and really do seem superior to the smaller cubes in terms of drink watering and chilling. And the best part is that you can just throw the mold in the dishwasher when you start getting that hard water build-up on the tray. All told, I'm pretty happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice round ice
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good. I’m not an engineer but I wonder if bottom half of each ball was raised a 1/16 if inch above flat if it would create a better ball. Most of time there good. Sometimes I wash them in cold water to round them better and put in the freezer. It is easy to get the ice out and easy to clean. Overall a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. I was worried that the ice wouldn’t come out round or it would be difficult to use. They ended up working great. There we a very slight learning curve to getting perfectly round balls. But if you flex the mold in all directions before you open the mold to remove the ice, it breaks off the rings around the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Great iced ball cubes!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that you could make ball shaped ice cubes from a tray. I was wrong, because this tray makes perfect, round ice balls easily. It took a couple practice trays until I got it right. You have to get the correct volume of water and you must bend the frozen tray to crunch away any extra ice around the balls before removing the tray so that you end up with perfect spheres. It really is quite easy! I love the finished product and getting there is actually fun.
customer_reviews.author: Marianjm

customer_reviews.title: Cool little ice spheres for drinks.
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy so far, it works really well to make circular ice. Very easy to get the ice out of the mold, which is a problem I've had with other molds, but I find that quite often there's a thin layer of ice around the seam which spoils the illusion of a perfect sphere. They do say you should remove the ice spheres and store them in a separate container in the freezer, and then store the silicon mold outside the freezer so it doesn't get a freezer burn smell. I've been doing that, and it doesn't have any smell yet. We'll see how long it holds up, but for now I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Living in the heart of Bourbon country we have a high expectation for products marketed to use with Bourbon. I had previously purchased individual ice ball molds but they were difficult to get full and one of them broke early on. This mold is great and the ice balls are great to use for bourbon on the rocks.
customer_reviews.author: krobinson

customer_reviews.title: These make me smile
customer_reviews.text: The spheres were a little bigger than I expected but that just makes them last longer. I may get a few more. I've used both water and coffee in these. It took a little while to get the water level right to get perfect spheres but once I figured it out I now get perfect balls every time.
customer_reviews.author: CLS CA 71

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice ball maker! It took a couple of times to figure out exactly how much liquid to put in to get a perfect ice ball but after you play around with it a few times you will get the hang of it. Very easy to use and the ice balls last a lot longer in your glass than regular ice cubes. You can also make several ahead of time and put in plastic container in freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Martin Hill

customer_reviews.title: They are way smaller than expecting
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price but the size of the ice balls are completely misleading and the container is basically molded rubber. I mean the ice balls are tiny, I have a mold that's twice as large but only downside was that they are single packaged so they leak sometimes these don't leak but it's nothing to marvel at. Product is okay.. marketing strategy is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to server your Macallan on the rocks and it does not water down fast
customer_reviews.text: Ok - as a single malt guy, these are super cool. It takes a few times to learn the best way to fill it. I just put it in a tupperware container just a little bigger and then fill it and push the top down. I dump out the excess from the tupperware and put this with water in the top as well in the tupperware in the freezer. The top ends up with ice on it, but oh well. I get a nice ball of ice for my Macallan.
customer_reviews.author: Capt T

customer_reviews.title: Ice balls are cool!
customer_reviews.text: These ice balls are great! They are about the size of a golf ball and are solid. I am satisfied that I will be the envy of my friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Just don't like the product.
customer_reviews.text: The tray is hard to fill without getting water all over the top and you can't really pour it off without pouring out the water from inside. When everything comes together the ice balls will fit into your water bottle without any issues. However they are smaller than what I had thought. Still considering whether to return........
customer_reviews.author: Adrian S.

customer_reviews.title: The Balls are not as big as they look in the picture ( That's what she said )
customer_reviews.text: Yo, these round ice cube are the size of golf balls ( they give you the impression that the ice balls are the size of billiard pool ball ) The Balls are not as big as they look in the picture ( That's what she said ) You gonna have to use 2 to 3 ice ball in the glass to impress your guest ! Maybe buy four ice tray ! good luck
customer_reviews.author: The 45 King

customer_reviews.title: Finally ice cubes!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, this little gem in fact makes ice cubes without breaking the maker!!!!!!! I have tried countless other types with out useful ice cubes and in the process of removing them, breaking the container!! Thank you thank you thank you, I will be placing another order right away!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen C.

customer_reviews.title: Cool product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool product. Makes ice balls to put in your drink. It’s a novelty item for sure but it looks cool when you put this in your glass
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I really do enjoy having these cubes
customer_reviews.text: I really do enjoy having these cubes. the silicone tray works really well. It released the cubes very easily - a simple twist in each direction breaks off the extra ice chips around the edges. the balls come out perfectly formed. I found when placed directly into a beverage, the balls become nearly transparent. Not quite as good as the photo here shows, but quite nice. I even made a few trays in advance so I would have enough ice balls to share with guests. One thing to expect is that the balls do commonly split in half along the seam line. Not every time, but I lose some out of every batch to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Well worth getting this type of ice mold. I don't know why but these ice balls sure stick around pretty long. I use them in my mix drinks and they don't water down the drink much since they melt so slow. As for the mold itself, the ice cubes won't come out as perfect spheres like some people might expect. You will most likely have to break off a little bit of flashing to make them look neat. All in all, these are really good ice cubes even if they don't look the prettiest.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's Cool, Pun Intended
customer_reviews.text: These are fun. The little round Ice balls are great for whisky, scotch, or other beverages that are served in traditional whisky glasses. They cool the beverage but limit the dilution that you get with crushed or small cubes of ice.
customer_reviews.author: R.K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Golf Ball Ice is Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got this shape and another (sphere, different vendor) as an anniversary present for my husband. They just look so cool (no pun intended) in the glass. Impressive really. We liked them so much, we are getting some for his dad's birthday. Happy hubby, happy whiskey, equals happy me. I tried to take a picture, but it just doesn't show up as well as the image they use for advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great for Whiskey!
customer_reviews.text: These ice balls are great for whiskey! They are a little smaller than I originally thought but they are great for the average size low ball! I thought these would be difficult to use in that I would experience water spillage in the freezer! But NOPE! Great for entertaining! And a great gift - I gave my son in law these too - because I knew as soon as I served them with their whiskey they'd be like "MA - where'd you get these?" And I was right they did! That's why I ordered three of these at one time!
customer_reviews.author: Fonda

customer_reviews.title: Do not expect clear ice
customer_reviews.text: The photo is a bit misleading. This product will not make clear ice as depicted. And, it's nearly impossible to get perfectly round ice without shards of ice around the equator. Corkcicle works better if you're looking for clear ice.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Damp

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ice Balls
customer_reviews.text: I first had a scotch at a restaurant with a huge chunk of ice several years ago and realized how good that worked chilling without watering down. Now I can enjoy at home
customer_reviews.author: bar k

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get "perfect" spheres -- but I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: The balls (perfect or not) are much longer-lasting than freezer-made ice. The best way to use them is to fill the molds with whatever liquid you plan to use them in (i.e., iced tea); then as they melt your beverage is not diluted. I only rated four stars because it isn't an exact science to get them filled correctly...and placing them on the freezer shelf can be tricky if the freezer is very full. It would be easier, if there was some sort of removable frame/support for stability.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Ealy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this!
customer_reviews.text: Ice balls are so much better than ice cubes. It makes 4 at a time - I put them in a plastic bag and have them available whenever I need them. They melt slower which is great. I won't be using ice cubes I the future - only "ice balls".
customer_reviews.author: Travelcat

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic. They took a little longer than I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. They took a little longer than I thought to freeze but they are worth the wait. As other posters have commented, there will be a small seam that you can use the back of a knife to knock off. The same goes for the little bump on top that forms from the overflow. Are they as perfect as the display shows? I haven't perfected them like that yet, but I'm working at it. I also tried filling it with water that had been boiled and that got clearer ice which was cool. Totally worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jemgirl

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered! easy to use, easy extract and above all, the ice balls stayed as a ball and not break in half or pieces like the ice ball maker from Makers Mark. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Salapack

customer_reviews.title: Cool Spherical Ice Cube Tra
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to use, they create almost perfect spherical cubes, and the finished product is easy to remove from the mold in comparison to some harder body plastic ones I have used. The ice balls are a little smaller than I would prefer, but I can't complain about the finished product that adds a little something extra to those home made cocktails you wouldn't get from the old ice cube trays.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Ice Mold
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the fun of it. I like ice with my beverages. It is easy to use but need a little help separating the ice balls. I see there are other similar options on Amazon that look a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: SQ

customer_reviews.title: Needs more work than you think.
customer_reviews.text: Item works as described but it can leave a ring of frozen water around the ice ball that needs to be shaved off so the result is not always a perfect sphere. Also, it absolutely must be placed on a flat surface or the water will escape the mold. I had to get a plank of plastic to use this product. Lastly, to achieve water ice as clear as shown in the picture you have to used degassed water. Put the water under vacuum to pull the air out and then the ice will be clear. Otherwise the ice will always be cloudy with bubbles. The item is easy to fill and use otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Little

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: These were a fun gift for my husband. He thought they were hilarious and uses it for his whiskey.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: A great mold for balls of ice....
customer_reviews.text: Quality material. Ice comes out nicely formed and easy to remove. I like the size of the balls also, not too big. The mold washes out nicely in preparation for your next set of balls. Be sure to line up the the top and bottom of the mold with the notches to assure proper forming of the ice balls.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, ice spheres come out like expected. They look cool in your glass. I bought a few sets. I use 2 spheres in each glass. They are a little smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.author: Chelly StClair

customer_reviews.title: Cubes a little smaller than expected but still decent size
customer_reviews.text: The cubes were a little smaller than I was expecting. It is hard to get the cubes to come out rounded. I ended up with edges of ice around the center of the cubes. Also, figured out if you overfill them up to the holes on top they come out looking a little weird. Overall they are great for just a drink for me and my husband but if you want to impress guests with perfect cubes these may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Solsticegirl

customer_reviews.title: Novelty ice - not bad!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it promised, round, big ice balls, that last for awhile. Since it only makes 4 at a time, if you intended to fill an ice bucket with these, you'd have to plan ahead (or buy several)! It was fairly easy extracting the ice from the mold.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Katz

customer_reviews.title: Great spheres if you are very careful, decent spheres if you aren't.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great spheres! Just not quite as perfect as I would want them to be. Unless you are extremely careful, you will not get perfect spheres. I don't really mind that they aren't perfect since they are just for my own drinks, but if you are entertaining guests and really want these to be perfect, you either need to be very careful and practice beforehand or find a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to remove. Lasts longer in your cup than standard ice cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Bourns

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the product. I have four trays and I empty the ice spheres into a container and fill the trays again. It's a little time consuming, but they serve their purpose. I had a party a few weeks ago and my guest chose the ice ball's in the container in my freezer versus getting ice from the icemaker. I suppose it was a novelty. I had several people make cute comments.
customer_reviews.author: Debiornotdebi

customer_reviews.title: A bit small
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly, but the ice balls are a little small (about the size of an ice cube). I really wanted one of those ice balls that fills a rocks glass like at the trendy bars.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Awesome as a gift! Have used mostly water, haven't used any other liquid so far. Don't know about using it for a different function (e.g. baking). Final product (sphere) will often times have an extra piece of water on the top near hole. Not completely round but its still cool! Would buy a different mold/shape next time.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Not eligible for return
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product during holidays. Got it fairly quickly. The size was smaller than what i expected.. My mistake prob, should have paid more attention to the specs. But the ice balls were difficult to get to a perfect sphere. Out of 8, prob 2 came up in proper shape, others got deformed to some extent. Lesson learnt - got to be more careful about how you pour water in the mold and place it in the freezer. But what i did not really like was that they did not allow me to return it after i found these issues within a week of receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: Atul Agrawal

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, but Messy and Problematic...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but messy and problematic. You have to guess how much water to add to each tray because there is no fill line. If you put too much water in the tray, it overflows through to top hole and you end up with ice all over the outside of the tray. If you don't get enough water inside the tray, you end up with deformed ice cubes. The silicone trays, filled with water, are also hard to carry to the freezer without dripping water from the external overflow area.
customer_reviews.author: Jaded Princess

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic. I bought them for scotch
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I bought them for scotch, now, I use them for all the ice in my house now. The nice round ice cubes last a lot longer and don't water down your drink as fast. I use them with distilled water to make nice clear ice balls. Easy to use with the only problem being that water can sometimes spill out of the sides. Oh well, just set it on a towel and go.
customer_reviews.author: BenStark

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the description better, but in the picture with the ice in ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the description better, but in the picture with the ice in the glass and someone's adult baby hand they appear larger, they are actually quite small like a golf ball really.I have to use a funnel that I have for my flask to get the water in the mold and would recommend it. I haven't been able to get a perfect mold, I;m sure in time it might happen, but due to the inability to get it perfect straight out the box then this product only deserves 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I expected more after watching a video review. Regardless of weight/pressure, the four spheres meld together. It makes it almost impossible to have a smooth surface if that matters.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael McCartney

customer_reviews.title: Easy removal. Study silicone
customer_reviews.text: Had a little trouble at first. Wish it was more than 4 at a time. Easy to remove and clean. A little slower to melt but not much ( but I also live in Florida-lol)
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: The right touch
customer_reviews.text: Who likes watered down alcohol? I I certainly don't. These spheres give you just that. Not only do they provide the non watered down drink but they make your drinks look like you're a connoisseur.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Small Balls!!!
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have looked at the description rather than the photo. I expected these to be large ice balls. They are no larger than a regular ice cube. I had to put 2 in a whiskey glass and they melted pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Moye

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t worth it
customer_reviews.text: This worked okay the first time I used it. However, Between the first and second use, it warped and now no longer holds water long enough to make the ice shape.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Truly, truly awful!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these. First off, the molds do not function well. After the first use, it is IMPOSSIBLE to get them back together properly--so you waste a lot of water trying to fill them. (And, if you are using spring water as you should be, the cost adds up.) Plus they are much smaller (under 2" in diameter) than you expect based on the listing. So you don't get one impressive ice ball in your whiskey, you get to little ones which aren't impressive at all.
customer_reviews.author: NOYDB

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Leakproof and easy to use. Great cocktails immensely enjoyed!
customer_reviews.author: Mattsonlinedeals

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s a good ice ball tray. Thick silicone that feels durable and will hold its shape for a while. Filling is easy- just fill the bottom section of the tray and the push down on the top, allowing excess water to spill out. The trick is pouring off water from the top of the tray without pouring out any water from the wells. If you don’t pour off the water on the top of the tray, it will freeze in a solid block and will make getting the ice balls out more difficult. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: WA

customer_reviews.title: love these, never get the "perfect" ball
customer_reviews.text: love these, never get the "perfect" ball, but, the seam does not bother me, most of the excess seam is easily removed just by twisting the mould around. i find overfilling so you get the water on the outside lid helps weigh the mould enough so the inside join is smaller. i didnt really bother reading the instructions, just read the reviews and tried it for myself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and clean. Makes a great size ball for my libations. I have tried other similar products and have thrown them away but this one works well and I am very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Gollaher

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little practice on how much water to put in despite directions (could just be me - very possible). Once we got a hang of it we were good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey A

customer_reviews.title: Fun ice cubes
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these round ice cubes! They are easy to make and come out easily. I just wish there was a fill line on the inside so we knew the exact spot to fill to in order to make the perfect round ice cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Fun Ice Breaker!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to make an impression or a fun addition to a drink, these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to achieve the perfect sphere look as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It’s a super cool concept, and my boyfriend uses them, but it’s super difficult to achieve the perfect sphere shape that they promote it to look like- kinda deceiving! Other than that, they’re a fun gift idea.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie B.

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Not a great ice ball maker. The mold is flimsy, so it's easy to work with, but also doesn't make a good seal, leaving the balls misshapened, with edges that need to be broken off.
customer_reviews.author: Fortismos

customer_reviews.title: Novel idea but needs work
customer_reviews.text: Works but doesn't come out clean ice balls. Lots of waste and debris. When you fill it you have to fill it in the holes but it runs over to all four through the one hole so I'm confused why there is four holes.
customer_reviews.author: Sphinx

customer_reviews.title: It is what I was looking for.  Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: makes a nice round ice cube for drinks. Not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS O

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift---it arrived the day after I ordered it and the person that received it is extremely happy with the way it works.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. Ice balls dont water down drink
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun item. It doesn't make perfect ice balls as shown in the pictures but it comes close and is easy to use. Recommended a couple of sets to get a good supply for a party.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: works great on thing i would say is they're a little smaller than i thought they would be but they work great. no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Edge

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Liked ease of taking ice out of mold. Disappointed that ice mold diameter less than what I expected (though was the measurement advertised), prefer ice ball at least 1.5 x & especially 2 x as large.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting cool looking ice cubes
customer_reviews.text: These things are great to use and keeps your drinks cold for a decent amount of time. Im buying a second set. I will say pouring the water in and transporting it to your freezer without spilling some may prove to be slight tricky and so in my experience they ALL didnt come out perfect cylinders
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Water seeps between the two layers causing all the balls to be connected by a layer of ice at the middle. Works just fine. Unless you want a flawless ice ball but after the first drink will you really care?
customer_reviews.author: Erin Watson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to read what size you’re getting. I was looking at a few different ones and these seemed like a good price but when they arrived they were much smaller than I thought. I bought them as a gift and my sister loves them though! She uses them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Harp

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: It does not form clear ice spheres as shown in the picture, and they come out nowhere near as cleanly as that, and it was a bit smaller than I had imagined. When I put the water in to the right level and push on the top a lot of water spills out. Will the water really expand into a full ice sphere when it freezes or am I doing something wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great ice tray
customer_reviews.text: Really good material quality and easy to clean. Might buy another tray.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ballz
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and cool. I now have chilly balls in my whiskey.
customer_reviews.author: graham moulden

customer_reviews.title: Very small ice balls
customer_reviews.text: These are very small and not big as suggested in the product listing. The balls do come out smooth but the size is a disappointment. I would not buy them had I known they were so small.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ice balls
customer_reviews.text: This is ,in my opinion, the perfect size ice ball. I use them for Bourbon,sometimes ice is difficult to remove, but these work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Read directions for perfect ice balls
customer_reviews.text: Takes a few practice runs, but these are perfect for cocktails.
customer_reviews.author: Karley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool Ice Sphere
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Exactly like picture. However, its a little hard to get the shape of the sphere. May take a little time to get use to but its still awesome. Take your time when it comes to adding water. If not done correctly you will end up with half of a sphere.
customer_reviews.author: YANIRA

customer_reviews.title: Slightly too small, but quick.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone can ever make clear ice balls it's not me. The internet hints on clear ice don't work for me. I gave it to my daughter in college; she'll have fun with it. I bought a couple bigger molds (Tovolo) that take a good 8 hours to make and they're not clear either, but the length of time it takes to freeze them seems to make them less cloudy than the Chilz. The problem with the Tovolo molds is the ball has big cracks in it. Back to the freezer/er, drawing board?
customer_reviews.author: SloopJohnB

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!  Perfect for any whiskey drinker!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband, he loves his whiskey and was annoyed at how quickly the "regular" ice would melt, "ruining" his drink. These work amazing well! Easy to fill, easy to break open, no harm to my hands and most importantly - hubby really loved his drink! :D
customer_reviews.author: Jan Strohecker
